node.text:
Making a difference and “brightening someone’s day” has always been on the top of my bucket list and what inspires my work every day.

In celebration of essie’s 40th birthday, I want to help you check this off your bucket list with #essie #eternaloptimist. 

I have created some art, using some of my favorite essie shades, for you to share with your friends and family to help brighten their day. Head over to @essie to see it! #essiepartner

node.text:
If you’ve ever been to a waterfall or heard the sound of one, it is likely that in one way or another, the waterfall caused you to stop in your tracks. Waterfalls are known around the world for their serene, peaceful beauty.

Every time I’ve personally been to a waterfall, just standing there and taking it all in is more than enough.

But every time I’ve had moments like this, this has come from the sidelines of the waterfall. Either looking down or looking up to the water falling, I’m not necessarily in danger, as a bystander, taking it all in.

Since I spend most of my life outside of the water, it’s easy to forget all that had to take place for this waterfall to be…the river flowing over hard rock and then soft rock that erodes in order for the waterfall to even exist. And it’s this gradual process of erosion that creates the waterfalls we see today.*

I do not know what the rocks and the water feel as they go through this process, but I do know this: in fact, a process…one that can be difficult to fully grasp when standing along the edges.

I think this can also true in other areas of life. When we arrive at some peaceful place, some peaceful moment…we can forget all it took to get there. We can forget all that the rivers carved and the rocks eroded into shape so we could enjoy this beautiful, peaceful wonder.

May we never forget
all it takes
for any beautiful
peaceful moment
to fall into place.
May we never forget
that even if it’s nothing more
than a deep breath,
a short rest,
or a brief quiet moment of a long day,
it took a lot to get here.
May we remain ever grateful
for all it took to be here.

MHN

*Source: Waterfall (Wikipedia)

node.text: This is an excerpt of today's podcast: "When You're Worried About The Future: 7 Phrases To Repeat To Yourself." node.text:
I am sitting here today reading @christineyisuh ‘s posts (who I recommend following), because yesterday’s events in Atlanta are a painful reminder of the lack of change and justice — what happened yesterday breaks my heart and makes me angry. 

This uphill battle involves too big of a hill — the grief, weariness, and exhaustion from being gaslighted and not even being believed that your experiences are even real—it takes a toll on the body. The heart. The soul. It takes a toll on the community. 

We must listen to the stories and accounts of anti-Asian violence and racism. We must fight for justice. And to those on the receiving end of this racism, I just want you to know you are free to feel and you are worthy of spaces where your anger, grief, frustration, and outcries are not gaslighted and rejected...you are allowed to be angry or weary or exhausted of having to communicate, explain, and wait for change. No matter the ones who try to downplay the need for justice, you are worthy of support.

node.title: when you are weary waiting for change

node.text:
Transcript:
“you do not have to know
the names
of every tree
to see their individual,
yet collective beauty.
you can see how
they fit into the landscape
whether they offer shade
or whether they
bear flowers or fruit,
there is room
for trees
of all kinds
to grow
around you.
I wonder
what a difference it could make
if we saw beauty
in each other in the same way.
If we recognized that
no matter our age,
or our shape,
there was room
for each of us
to spring up from our roots
how we were meant to.
for there is an endless depth
to me and you,
that goes beyond what we see.
beyond the shade or size of our leaves,
beyond the color and texture of our bark,
this landscape
supports growth
right here
where you are.
some deciduous,
and others evergreen,
through every season
in the Light
every single tree
is seen.”
MHN

node.text:
take heart,
breathe deep, 
especially when
you have to say goodbye
before you were ready.
this will not be easy
and this you already know.
you are slowly moving through this.
you feel it in your bones.
and even here,
you free
to breathe and simply breathe.
feel what you need to feel.
and let every moment be
what it needs to be.

III

I think this
is the kind
of goodbye
that you don’t say out loud.
I might not find the words
until a few years from now.

I carry memories
like watercolor
running wild in my mind.
Some things  were meant to flow,
blues and yellows
you learn to let them go.

MHN

About this piece:
This is a piece written for anyone who has had to say goodbye before they were ready. Whether it was something beautiful that you never imagined going away, or something that would end in only a matter of time…I just hope you know it is okay to pace yourself through the spectrum of emotions that come along with that. This piece doesn’t end with a call-to-action resolve for a reason…I just wanted to create space for those feelings.

node.title: If you have to say goodbye before you're ready:

node.title: Remember how far you have come

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 19, 2021. May be an image of nature, mountain and text that says 'STILL HOPE HAVE'.

node.text:
"What’s the worst that could happen?" Many of us can answer that question immediately. Our minds don’t struggle to create scenarios for what could go wrong, because we've already lived through worst-case scenarios. When it comes to hope for the future, we're skeptical.

And maybe, there's grace for that.
Grace to feel the weight of our losses.
And also grace to ask new questions, when the heart is ready
(even if it's ever-so fleeting, childlike, and feels a bit naive):

What’s the best possible outcome?
What would I do with my life today if I was going to be okay?
What if I ended up being surprised by the future in a good way?

You might not be able to lean into these kinds of questions every day, for every circumstance, all the time. But what matters is giving yourself permission to ask a brand new set of questions because you’re allowed to imagine something better. You’re free to dream of the best-case scenarios for yourself, your family, friends, and your community.

Of course, you can't control outcomes and there is no way to predict what other people will do, but it is possible to:
be loving without being controlling.
be hopeful without toxic positivity.
dream without ignoring grief, struggle, reality.

And we can do this by:
listening before we speak.
trusting that we don’t always have to say or do things to make a difference.

Dreaming of a best-case scenario is a practice of hope, but it doesn't mean forcing positivity into spaces of grief and loss in our own lives or the lives of others. Oftentimes, it just means learning to ask ourselves new questions:

How can I be a hopeful presence in someone’s life without words?
How can I dream of best-case scenarios that are empathetic and inclusive?
How can I do something good, kind, and hopeful that I won't be able to take the credit for?
How can I practice hope, right here?

MHN

node.text: This took me 3 days…and here’s what it taught me ♥️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 17, 2021. May be an image of mountain and text that says 'THERE ARE So MANY THINGS YOUDONOT YET KNOW, BUT AMIDST IT ALL, YOU CAN STILL KNOW PEACE. -ΜΗΝ'.

node.text:
“Peace” is so much more than a feel-good positive message. It is freedom from disturbance. It is the ability to see that despite your current state, there is room to be untroubled within your soul. 

Having peace doesn’t mean you’re avoiding or deflecting. It means you are choosing to be calm despite the presence of stressors. Having peace affects the way you respond to others. It affects the way you give answers about your plans for the future, even you’re still figuring things out. It affects the way you see the success of others, knowing it cannot be compared to yours. Knowing peace can completely change your worldview.

You do not need permission from anyone in order to pursue peace in this season of your life. You do not have to hold your breath because that’s what everyone else is doing. You are free to exhale, and to know it is well, even here, in your uncertainty.

Be mindful of the need for certainty that keeps you from pursuing peace on a daily basis. Whether it comes from those around you, or within. You do not have to know everything in order to know peace.

MHN

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 17, 2021. May be an image of mountain and text that says 'THERE ARE So MANY THINGS YOUDONOT YET KNOW, BUT AMIDST IT ALL, YOU CAN STILL KNOW PEACE. -ΜΗΝ'.
Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 17, 2021. May be a black-and-white image of text that says 'You are free to exhale, and to know it is well, even here, in your uncertainty ΜΗΝ'.
Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'GRATEFUL'.

node.text:
May the morning sun sing to you: you are worthy of new beginnings.

May an extra hour of sleep reveal to you:
you are worthy of rest.

May a text from a friend you haven’t heard from in a while remind you: someone does care.

May the texture of a well-worn t-shirt you put on today remind you of how you have taken care of your things in a mindful way.

May the scent that ignited a positive memory remind you that even in the most difficult things, you still managed to keep that beautiful moment with you.

May the breath that leaves your body remind you how even here, amidst all you are holding, you are capable of release.

May the song lyric that speaks to your soul remind you that you are not alone.

May the illuminated windows of the homes beneath the evening sky remind you: that somewhere in the world, someone found home tonight. Love still runs wild within us, even at a distance.

May the winding down of the day remind you, tomorrow is on its way, and even though it is unknown, you will not be alone as you travel there. Light will meet you on the path. Hope will last.

May every day remind you: even in the smallest shapes, there is room to practice gratitude.

MHN

Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Even in the smallest shapes, there is room to practice gratitude. ΜΗΝ'.
Photo by Morgan Harper Nichols on September 15, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'YOU MAYHAVE NO IDEA WHATLIESAHEAD, BUTYOUALSO HAVE NO DEA JUST HOW STRONG YOU ARE ΜΗΝ'.

node.text:
You may no idea
what lies ahead,
but you also
have no idea
just how strong you are.

I hope you never let your past failures overshadow your past successes. The failures will always scream at you the loudest, but when you actually listen to what they’re saying, they don’t tell the story. You do. You are the one who gets to choose to shine light on the lessons you learned. You are the one who has the freedom to see what turned out be a success, or even just progress, far more than you see the failures.

Yes, there are so many things that have fallen in apart, and there are people and there are disappointments they have broken your heart, but they did not tell the whole story. They simply do not have that power.

I hope you can embrace the grace that says, “you are so much more than failures.” I hope in any moment you spend thinking about the past (whether it be yesterday or ten years ago), you think about the good that came out of it. And most of all, I hope you can make peace with what was, as you wait for what’s to come.

You are so much stronger and equipped for the future than you think.

MHN

node.text:
#sponsored This year has brought a new sense of perspective that has taught us to actively seek out growth and inspiration. Starting my day with a cup of coffee is a joy as I watch my son playing with toys or getting lost in thought while staring at the sway of the flowers in my backyard. I wrote the words “you will bloom how you were meant to” to speak to this beautiful reality about our lives. Under the sun and rain, it takes time for that flower to come to life and I think that’s an important truth for humans to hold on to too. No matter what each day brings, we will bloom how we were meant to.

I am so excited to partner with @starbucks by @nespressousa for an experience that highlights growth and inspiration. "Morning Mantras" is a new Instagram effect that starts your day on an uplifting note, by pairing my words with the signature café taste and quality of new Starbucks coffee at home available with Starbucks® by Nespresso® for Vertuo.

Find the mantra that inspires you by looking for “Morning Mantras” in the Instagram effects library. You can also find “Morning Mantras” in the Effects tab of my profile.

node.text:
To the one who is struggling to feel what they need to feel right now:

Consider that collectively, we are in a place where many of us are feeling nameless feelings right now. It is possible that years down the line, we may have to create new words to describe what we were feeling in this space. Some of the words we use to describe what we're experiencing right now just might not feel like enough...and maybe, that's okay...because we have never been here before. This is all brand new, and maybe, the words will need to be new, too. Perhaps, feeling what you need to feel is a process...and finding the language for those feelings is a process, too.

So as you venture into the depths
of feeling your nameless emotions,
and you try to make sense of things
that you don't have the answers for,
remember that it feels like you're entering in the wild, you are.
And as terrifying as that might be, there is grace to breathe through.
There is grace to not compare your journey
into deeper vulnerability to anyone else.
There is grace for allowing time
to find the right language for your experiences.

MHN

node.text: Over the past few years, I’ve talked to people who have experienced loss much greater than any loss I’ve ever known, including those who lost people on this day, 9/11. As much as I think about how scary this day was for me as an 11 year old, I can’t help but to think about how, somewhere in New York, there was another 11 year old and many others who lost and had to grieve so much more…and 20 years later, I just hope you know, whatever feelings are there…whether you have names for those feelings or not—there is room for what you’re feeling. You’re not a burden. You’re not too much. Your feelings are not a burden. You are worthy of love. You are worthy of peace.

node.text:
I cannot tell you what this season will bring out of you, but I can tell you it matters to keep showing up every day. I can tell you that it matters to give love, even though you do not think you are good enough. Your presence matters, even in this chapter. Even if you feel overlooked, alone, or far from home, you belong in this life just as much as anyone else, no matter how others see you, or how you see yourself.

Whether you had the most productive week or everything felt like it was severing at the seams, there are signs of strength and movement with every breath you breathe. Take heart, breathe deep. Even before things fall into place. For even here, in these unknowns, you are wrapped in endless, boundless grace.

Carry on into this next week at peace knowing that you gave what you were able to give. And for all of the things you wish went differently, you are learning from them.

You are learning where to establish boundaries.
You are learning where to let go.
You are learning when it’s best to surrender.
You are learning to listen to your body when it needs rest.
You are learning to be grateful for your progress even though you are far from finished yet.

Inhale and exhale with gratitude knowing that no matter how things turned out this week, what you were able to give matters...even if others don’t notice.

Continue to do what you do for love.
Continue to notice how you’ve grown in courage and help others do the same.
Continue on the journey of sowing good seeds and making meaningful connections.
Trust: the fruit of the work you’re doing will grow when it’s time.

MHN

node.text:
5 things to repeat to yourself when you're feeling overwhelmed:

1. I am giving myself permission to take the time I need to rest.

2. I am giving myself permission to not have it all figured out at once.

3. I am giving myself permission to not have to be everything to everyone.

4. I am giving myself permission to add my own health and well-being to the list of things I care about.

5. I am giving myself permission to feel deeply and notice what I am feeling...while knowing this doesn't mean I have to carry everything on my shoulders.

MHN

node.text:
10 things you can say “yes” to today:

1
Spending more time with the people who energize you

2
Spending time doing nothing at all, and not feeling bad about it

3
Scheduling more time for you to do something you enjoy, no matter how small it is

4
Not having to have an explanation for why you're saying "no" to something

5
Doing things that would make your childhood self filled with joy

6
Doing things that would make your 90-year-old self smile

7
Getting an extra hour of sleep

8
Taking some much-needed time off

9
Just seeing where the present moment in a quiet space leads you

10
Continuing to become who you were meant to be, regardless of the pressures you feel from the world

MHN
This is an excerpt from this week's series in my app "Storyteller" called "Breathe Deep and Seek Peace Right Here." I hope that with every day this week, this pieces can remind you to find at least one moment in the day to slowly exhale, and seek peace in the present moment.
